Defines struct to track resource usage and hardware flags for kernels and entry functions.

<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Number of VGPRs that meets number of waves per execution unit request.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/siprograminfo/#aa8ccab82d407519b9d648b03505332de"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcexpr">MCExpr</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/siprograminfo/#aa8ccab82d407519b9d648b03505332de">NumVGPRsForWavesPerEU</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Final occupancy.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/siprograminfo/#abfc73b7fe494d43b1b5d5ee421823a28"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcexpr">MCExpr</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/siprograminfo/#abfc73b7fe494d43b1b5d5ee421823a28">Occupancy</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Whether there is recursion, dynamic allocas, indirect calls or some other</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// reason there may be statically unknown stack usage.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Bonus information for debugging.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The constructor sets the values for each member as shown in the struct.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// However, setting the MCExpr members to their zero value equivalent</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// happens in reset together with (duplicated) value re-set for the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// non-MCExpr members.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
